result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Scott Maly in court.  Attorney Sarah E. Schuchardt in court for Benjamin Scott Maly.  Court states cases and appearances.  State notes victim requirements have been met and victim is present and would like to make a statement.  Atty Schuchardt states she talked to ADA Arevalo yesterday and they are not prepared to proceed to plea/sent today to plea/sentencing.  Court notes 22CM28 already has NG plea and she enters NG pleas to 22CM161 also.  Both matters will be set for TSC in about 60 days.  Bonds continued.
